ovdesc.p: This Table contains company level default values which will be used when processing stock dividend transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: Default transaction code for all Security Debit type entries within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Standard default value for all Depository Credit type transactions within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction code.
Default debit type transaction code for all depository entries within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction code.
Standard default of the Nominee Co. indicated. It is unlikely that this facility be utilised but may be necessary where a Nominee Co. is not controlled by the bank concerned.
Note: Great care should be taken when entering this Nominee code as a default as the Nominee Co. code is used as part of the key in storing security positions.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters nominee code (type 'S'). Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.
Default debit type transaction code for depository transactions within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction code.
Default Bank commission rate applicable on all stock dividend type transactions.
This rate will default within the Stock.Div.Det input but it may be altered or overridden at that level also.
Standard Rate format.
Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries.

This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position.
4 or 5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.
Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
Default Category code for all Depository (Foreign) charges within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Category Code.
Specifies "Own Account Trading/Investment" portfolio.
Y or blank
The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Losses.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following range has been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory Input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Default Depository (Foreign) charge category code within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Category code.
Standard default delivery instructions for all stock dividend type transactions.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type 'S') security delivery instruction code. Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Securities Delivery Instruction (SC. DEL. INSTR.)
Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application.

9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric Local Code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
Must exist as a valid Company Code.
The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
The following range has been assigned within T24:
600 - 649 = Securities.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory Input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Internal suspense account used for processing payment accounting entries within the Stock Dividend Section.

When Customer records are created, two financial entries are posted; one to the customer and the other to this specified suspense account. Only when all customer records are posted will the Depository total be passed to the Nostro via this suspense Account.
4-10 type 'AAA' characters. Internal field.
Must exist as a valid Account Class.
Default category code for all client commission entries within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Category Code.
Default transaction credit code for all client entries within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
Standard default Category code for all foreign charges levied from a client within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Category Code.
Default credit transaction code for all Depository (Foreign) charges levied on a client within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Must exist as a valid Transaction code.
